alert.note: Alert for Utah Valley (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 12:37PM MST until December 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 5 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Utah Valley. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 AM MST Thursday, impactful snow starting after 5 PM. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An unusual combination of elevated winds and very cold temperatures will bring near to below 0 wind chills to the Wasatch Front.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
